alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Marathon; Portage; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 2:16AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wood, western Portage, southern Lincoln and Marathon Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 209 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Cornell to 7 miles south of Thorp to near Price. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and brief torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Additional rainfall of up to an inch could cause some minor flooding in parts of northern Marathon and southern Lincoln counties where 1 to 2 inches of rain has already fallen. Locations impacted include... Wausau, Stevens Point, Wisconsin Rapids, Marshfield, Weston, Merrill, Rib Mountain, Mosinee, Abbotsford and Spencer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central and north central Wisconsin.
